intro: Fusanus diversifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf fusanus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes, which range from elliptical to ovate, and its clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and is native to regions of eastern North America. It produces small, dark berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. The botanical features of Fusanus diversifolius make it a distinctive and ecologically valuable plant in its native habitat.
